definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
school/sect/purpose/model/ancestor/clan/to take as one's model (in academic or artistic work)/classifier for batches, items, cases (medical or legal), reservoirs
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
surname Yi/(Tw) abbr. for 義大利|义大利[Yi4 da4 li4], Italy

sentences.english: That part of the follow-up study stated at the outset.
sentences.chinese: 该部分为后续研究开宗明义。

sentences.english: The report states up front that science can change lives.
sentences.chinese: 这份白皮书开宗明义地指出了科学可以改变生活”。

definition: start of literary work/opening song of ballad in Tanci style 彈詞|弹词[tan2 ci2]
to concentrate on the main points (idiom); to bring out the essentials
the gist (of a text or argument)/the main points
to elucidate/to expound/to study and explain
one word says it all (idiom, from Analects); to cut a long story short/in a nutshell
to expound (a position)/to elaborate (on a topic)/to treat (a subject)
